gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Center for Geospatial Data Analysis (data compiler)

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: This is a collection of active weather stations in Indiana that are part of the National Weather Service's Cooperative Station Network.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: WEATHER_STATIONS_NCDC_IN was developed as a tool for display of weather station locations in Indiana in a GIS environment.

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: DATA DISCLAIMER: This data set was compiled by Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey, using data believed to be accurate; however, a degree of error is inherent in all data. This product is distributed "AS-IS" without warranties of any kind, either expressed or implied, including but not limited to warranties of suitability to a particular purpose or use. No attempt has been made in either the design or production of these data to define the limits or jurisdiction of any federal, state, or local government. These data are intended for use only at the published scale or smaller and are for reference purposes only. They are not to be construed as a legal document or survey instrument. A detailed on-the- ground survey and historical analysis of a single site may differ from these data. gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: This file is available to anyone, but access may be contingent on written request, specific terms relevant to the agency or person making the request, and/or current freedom of information statutes in the state of Indiana.

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: ESRI ArcGIS shapefile format, Microsoft Windows XP, approximately 204 KB

gmd:supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: The data in this point layer came from the National Climatic Data Center inventories of cooperative weather stations and automated surface observation stations used in the United States. The data were downloaded from: ftp://ftp.ncdc.noaa.gov/pub/data/inventories/COOP-ACT.TXT, ASOSLST.XLS.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: The resultant shapefile generated from the NCDC tabular data was checked to ensure that the same number of records was in the spatial data set as was in the tabular data set.

From the NCDC, "The information contained in Web Climate Services Version 2.1 is a "best effort" attempt to provide access to NCDC metadata. The contents of this system cannot be considered as official records. To obtain official records or to verify content found in this system please contact NCDC."

The station names were checked against a list of cooperative stations obtained from the Midwest Regional Climate Center (MRCC) and no discrepancies in the active stations were noted. The location information available from the National Climatic Data Center (NCDC) was of a higher precision (latitude and longitude reported in degrees, minutes, and seconds rather than degrees and minutes) than any other source. Many errors in climatic division assignments were found. No independent checks were conducted to determine errors in reported identification numbers for stations (for example, COOP numbers and WBAN numbers, etc.; see attribute descriptions for station information).

As reported by NCDC, "In recent years, the availability of Geopositioner (GPS) technology and the demand for more precise location information has increased the precision of these measurements to Whole Seconds." The postional accuracy of the GPS units used was not provided; the horizontal accuracy is an estimate. The accuracy was calculated to 0.0001 degrees, which is approximately 10 meters on the ground.

As reported by NCDC,"From NWS guidelines ground elevation is generally taken from temperature sensor location at airport sites, and from the rain gage location at other observing sites." No additional information was provided on vertical positional accuracy of these data.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: CGDA personnel imported COOP-ACT.TXT (inventory of active cooperative (COOP) weather stations in the United States) and ASOSLST.XLS (automated surface observation stations used by the National Weather Service in the United States) into separate worksheets in Microsoft Excel. Both worksheets were refined to contain only information about Indiana Weather stations. Both worksheets were merged and any duplicate records were deleted. The latitude and longitude coordinates were converted from degrees-minutes-seconds to decimal degrees by spreadsheet calculations. All formulae were converted to values. Only latitude and longitude coordinates in decimal degrees were retained; other coordinate fields were deleted. The spreadsheet was saved, and the geographic (latitude and longitude) decimal degree XY coordinates were used to import the point locations into ESRI ArcMap with a geographic coordinate system (NAD83). The point event theme was projected to UTM NAD83 Zone 16.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Indiana Geological Survey, Center for Geospatial Data Analysis

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: The working version of the weather station shapefile was joined to an edited Excel worksheet containing cooperative weather station types using the COOP identification number as the join field. The CLIMATE field was checked against the values contained in Climatic_Divisions_NCDC_IN.shp, and several errors were identified. The errors were corrected after verifying the station name, county name, and coordinates placed the station in the plotted location. Only fields from the joined tables that were desired were retained in the final output. The point layer was then exported to retain the attribute tabular modifications.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Indiana Geological Survey, Center for Geospatial Data Analysis

gmd:alternateTitle.gco:CharacterString: in_climate.shp, WebCliServ query results for Indiana weather station types, Climatic_Divisions_NCDC_IN.shp

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v. 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v. 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (U.S. Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Indiana Geological Survey, Center for Geospatial Data Analysis

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Climatic divisions for each Indiana county.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: CLIMATE_DIVISIONS_NCDC_IN: Climate Divisions in Indiana (National Climatic Data Center, 1:24000, Polygon Shapefile), data compilation by Sally Letsinger, 2008.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Inventory of station names, identification numbers, and locations in latitude and longitude (degrees, minutes, seconds) of active cooperative weather stations in Indiana coordinated by the National Weather Service (NWS).

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Weather Service's Cooperative Station Network

gmd:alternateTitle.gco:CharacterString: Active NWS cooperative weather station inventory

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It is not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Metadata was created as or translated to ISO 19139 for inclusion in the Big Ten Academic Alliance Geoportal.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project
